website_summaries.verdict: This fast router has the range to cover large areas and is rock solid for 4K streaming and gaming.
pros: This router features very good range and is fast enough to handle any video streaming or gaming task you can throw at it
cons: It requires some tech expertise in order to use this router to its fullest potential

website_summaries.verdict: Geeks with deep pockets might love the X10, but the majority of home users will find it too expensive for their daily networking needs.
pros: Supporting the new 802.11ad Wi-Fi standard, the Netgear X10 can deliver unprecedentedly fast wireless speeds
It also features ultrafast wired connections for high-end servers
It has speedy network storage performance, and the built-in Plex server for media streaming works well
cons: The router is expensive and bulky
The web interface is sluggish, unintuitive and doesn't allow for in-depth Wi-Fi customization
There are currently few devices that can take advantage of its high-end features, and its 802.11ad signal has extremely short range

customer_reviews.title: First day just blown away.
customer_reviews.text: Day one.... Amazed! GUI not great but I can figure it out. Setup to my original network IP and everything worked without touching it. My wife has been having issues with her last 2 iPhones using too much cellular data and dropping wifi when in bedroom upstairs on opposite side of house. On my Android I never had this problem and usually get 30Mbps. This X10 is on first floor outside wall in a solid wood computer desk cabinet. I have 2 outer antenna pointed upstairs and forward. Getting 215 mbps down and 22 up. First time ever seeing paid for speeds on WiFi. Unheard of. Previous router Asus rt-ac66u. This is day 1 so I will update if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: ElecEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I had was very slow wifi performance. After hours troubleshooting and talking with support, I was able to get them to send a replacement unit. The new unit is faster, but stutters massively when streaming live video. Watching things like youtube and netflix is fine because they can build a buffer... but using my Steam Link (wirelessly connected to a computer that is directly connected to the router) or playing online games on my PC over wifi is not possible. Lag spikes every 5-10 seconds means I freeze and other players teleport constantly. Absolutely unusable. Router has been updated, factory reset and manually configured to the best of my abilities. Just seems unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandizzle

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 DAYS!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a lemon. It happens. The setup was super easy, the app was nice. With our fiber optic service, speeds were incredible. The router worked awesome for 2 days. Then, it would connect to the devices, but not to the internet. My provider said there was data moving, but we had no service. They asked what changed, we told them about the new router. Tried several reboots, unplugged power for several minutes, hard shut down and reboot, all with provider on the phone. Nothing brought it back to life. Unplugged this and plugged in the old (11 year old) one, worked immediately. Sadly had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Daddybomb

customer_reviews.title: Best 4K and VR gaming router in the market.
customer_reviews.text: In the pandemic since schooling, college and work is all online from home I needed a router that is intelligent enough to route traffic efficiently managing between streaming and browsing. X10 is the router look no further. Easy to setup, simultaneous streaming, VR games and work is now so much fun with out painful buffering. I could not have selected a better router. I was using R8000 before and this router is twice better with strong Signal strength all over the house eliminating the need of signal extenders.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Nader

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 8 days
customer_reviews.text: The app for my smartphone (granted it's a couple years old) would not let me sign in even straight out of the box with factory default name password. Why is it router GUI interface programs are so darn slow? I was hoping for something that responded as fast as the router but Netgear has missed the mark once again! Since I only had the router for 8 days can't say much about how it operated, except to say most of the features did seem to work but not enough time to fully test. Not sure if I'll buy same product again as it is not available where I originally purchased (Amazon)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5g drop outs.  Buying an Asus next
customer_reviews.text: What can I say I bought the most expensive solution out there and loved the features. 6 months in I started having connection issues. Now the 5g cuts out frequently. Factory resets, new firmware, turning off all the features that I paid for, nothing fixes the issue. Online search there are a ton of us with the same problem. For most the router works at first and slowly dies. 1 year warranty. Figures given a lot of the start to fail at that time. Should have trouble shot this sooner and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Simon C Robinson

customer_reviews.title: The Nighthawk has been fantastic
customer_reviews.text: It's honestly been great. I have an AT&T 100Mbps connection into the Nighthawk. This single route provides 100% of the coverage in my 3000 square foot house. everything runs through this thing. x6 Wyze WiFi Cameras x2 MacBooks x1 iPad x WiFi Printer x2 Apple TVs Since COVID, we've been working from home constantly. We've not had a single connectivity issue since the install, not even a reboot. The chokepoint in my network is the ISP, not the Nighthawk. I do have both the Nighthawk and Modem on a UPS, so I don't really worry about brownouts or power loss issues.
customer_reviews.author: travis0260

customer_reviews.title: Not just a router - a great networkinig tool
customer_reviews.text: A superb networking tool. Following the Netgear supporting tools through the Nigthawk, network problems can be diagnosed, and solved. The user interface is so much easier than others. As a router its powerful signal provides coverage where others can not reach. It is quick and easy to install and set up to meet your needs. The WPS feature is very easy to use as well, and ensures consistent and efficient setup of other devices. Its ability to connec directly to external hard drive make it a tool that can be shared among all the wirelessly connected devices. GREAT, Wish I had bought one earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Fenneman

customer_reviews.title: Utter frustration
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, terrible tech support, even after paying $140 for a year of support. We don't even know why we're not getting no internet. After more than 10 hours of waiting in queue and talking to people in India and the Philippines, we now realize they're just reading out of a manual-- they know less than we do. Utter frustration. Never Netgear again. Save yourself the trouble, stay away from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Liddick

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This very expensive router is a major disappointment. My NETGEAR Nighthawk X10 AD7200 can hold a connection with the latest firmware. This causes havoc with connected cameras, thermostats. Computers seem to connect more slowly over wired or wireless connection. It is the fact that after 90 days Netgear wants to charge someone who pays hundreds of $$$ for a router. I have purchased Netgear router products for years - this is my last straw. The Community Boards are full of issues with cycling internet, lost connections and frustrations. Never thought I would right a review of disappointment. My advise is think very carefully before purchasing this router. I would not ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Terrible Device - DO NOT USE FOR BUSINESS
customer_reviews.text: I got this device to use for our small business and office and it's just incredibly bad. ***IF YOU RESTART THIS DEVICE YOUR DEVICES MAY NOT CONNECT AGAIN!**** Cell phones, laptops, and especially anything mac related loose their IP and can't connect after a reset. Additionally, wired devices attached to a switch are no longer accessible. Add into that the super clunky device manager (Gui blocks that shift every few seconds?) and this thing was returned within a few days. Their support as many have mentioned is not great and couple that with an 18 page long forum post about these issues that hasn't been addressed! Seriously...don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: CL or JG

customer_reviews.title: Big Promises, No delivery
customer_reviews.text: Many of the advertised functions still don't work **2 years later**. Netgear's Firmware updates continually break advertised features even further. Things like the network map, and access control lists continue to fail, and the phone app is abysmal at best. The PLEX server 'feature' is only a free trial that requires an annual subscription to use it. Their tech support is non-responsive, and despite many complaints in their own Community Support forum, they don't even acknowledge the posts. If you're a 'power user' do yourself a favor and pick something else. I would have given tech support no stars but there isn't a selection for that.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Smith

customer_reviews.title: Netgear recently released two models after this but this model is still the better workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: This unit was ahead of it's time when released. Now two years later the mainstream wifi devices finally caught up to the router so it makes an excellent mainstream to high end wifi router. This unit comes with 6 LAN ports which is awesome because not everything is wifi. Even can aggregate two ports for a high bandwidth use device like a NAS unit. Has a Plex server built in with two USB ports for storage accessible over the network or streamed through Plex. While this unit isn't "WiFi 6" like the two newer models from Netgear not many Wi-Fi devices are, making this an excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 146735

customer_reviews.title: My Wifi has never worked so well
customer_reviews.text: This product took my wifi to the next level. I'm into gaming, but I never really got so serious with it that I bought all of the best internet connectivity gear. However, I wish I would have gotten this router a long time ago. I didn't buy it for gaming, I bought it because I have a large home with lots of walls to hold up the signal. That is no longer an issue. It is so smooth even with my 7 devices hooked to it. I have hooked up everything I can to my router and the thing still doesn't miss a beat. I highly suggest this purchase even if you don't "need" it. It's on its own tier.
customer_reviews.author: Tuna

customer_reviews.title: So Bulletproof I Forget I Have It
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a highly touted ASUS router that began to be finicky. Gigabit ethernet finally became available in my neighborhood and this takes full advantage. My house is wired throughout with Cat 6 so the majority of my internet is through hard wired connections but our tablets and cell phones work perfectly all over the house. The best part is since it's been installed and set up I have never once had to touch it again and it's almost a year old.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Terrible brick
customer_reviews.text: Let me start out by saying I don't write many reviews. I'm also a huge netgear fan. My 4 previous routers were all netgear. This is the worst router and electronic purchase I've ever made. Constantly drops wifi signals and speeds go up and down. Check out netgear community forum to see all the complaints. My next purchase after this router was netgear arlo security cameras but I can't buy them because the wifi keeps dropping. It is not my ISP either. They replaced everything including the fiber line to my house. Huge disappointment and waste of money DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: X10 review
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup from iPhone, once I understood directions from NightHawk app. Replacement router, and it auto picked up everything on the network. Bit expensive, but I was out of a router for 7 days, and am home bound so an extra few bucks is well worth it. 60 band channel, I have no devices for that and do not care. I got 1000 mbps at the router from Cox, 500 MBPS with an extender through multiple walls, 50 ft away
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid performance so far
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a two month old Netgear Nighthawk R7000 that couldn't maintain either a wired or wireless connection for longer than an hour. This Nighthawk X10 is my last Netgear router. The user interface is identical to the R7000, with the addition of an automatic setup option and a new 60GHz radio. You don't have to reset the router every time you make a change and the firmware update took about 15 seconds. My speed test scores have jumped up to almost 3/4 of what I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Allmon

customer_reviews.title: My internet is 985mbps/ 1Gbps this peice of trash can only put out 250-300 on 5g connection.
customer_reviews.text: Wow,my panoramic is much better i mean holy god this thing is terrible. Unfortunately I thought this would help increase my speeds but it made it worse. In my 2.4ghz band i get 100 max on the cleased channel with or wo qos and my 5g band gets 200 usually 300mbps max. Do not believe this 800 2.4 band or 1700 5.ghz its total bs. Ive bever so badly wasted my money. Im sooooo tired of this bs. Speeds taken right by router.
customer_reviews.author: Dodge charger shi fu

customer_reviews.title: SCAM
customer_reviews.text: DO MOT PURCHASE! I purchased this product new from the Amazon Netgear store. I received a defective product that would no connect. When I called customer support they informed me this product was purchased months before, registered to a different name, and the warranty was now expired and they would not help me. STAY AWAY FROM THIS SELLER AND PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Pettijohn

customer_reviews.title: Really poor performance and the return policy is not acceptable
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Netgear fan for many years and thought this unit would work well. The 2.4 GHz range was really poor and speed dropped off very quickly once you were very far away from the device. I even tried changing the channel used (tried all of them actually) and nothing helped. Oh and buyer beware on the return policy. You need to try to return in 2-4 hours after receiving to get your money back. Who has the time to drop what you're doing, configure and test your new device within that amount of time?
customer_reviews.author: Forensic Guy

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor, or in English, let the buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: When online this router works great. However, when it goes offline the only way I can get it back online is to press the factory reset button as there is no way that I’ve found to toggle from offline to online. This works reliably but then you lose all your custom settings and must go through the initial setup process and enter all your custom parameters every time. I’ve found it necessary to do this about twice a month. I no longer bother entering custom parameters such as descriptive device identification.
customer_reviews.author: CampFireCook

customer_reviews.title: Don't check the smart connect feature
customer_reviews.text: I set up my 5g login and router name different from my 2.4gh network. The software somehow reset the smart connect feature and my 5g network disappeared and all of my devices could no longer connect. It took me about 90 minutes to figure it out, but there is a smart connect feature that allows devices to connect to either 2.4 0r 5.0gh networks for whichever signal is stronger at the time. When you select this the router name defaults to the 2.4 name and if you named your 5.0gh network different it does not show up. After figuring that out the router works great
customer_reviews.author: TPG55

customer_reviews.title: Wow...
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded from the ASUS RT-AC87U... and there is absolutely no comparison. The WiFi on this little beast is fantastic (granted, I'm currently only using 2.5Ghz and 5Ghz) and my internet download speed improved dramatically as well (at least 10%). My internal network file transfer speeds have literally tripled as well. I have yet to test my latency in games but I'm sure it is at least slightly better as well. Setting up OpenVPN was a breeze, although a way to generate new certs through the BUI would be a welcome addition. I'm using this with NIC teaming in combination with a Synology DiskStation 918+. Perfect combo. No complaints here! Amazing router.
customer_reviews.author: Squelch

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any of the problems others are having in the reviews. I live in Japan and have fiber through a local company and it's lightning fast. I run two tv's on wifi, my laptop and mobile devices simultaneously and a few through VPN and no noticeable lag. It's super expensive but as far as I'm concerned, I'm not concerned because it works. I'm sure if it stops working I'll lose my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I decided to cut the cable cord. I was paying a monthly bill for a router that had the worse WIFI . I have 1gig service and never had good speeds when connecting. I removed the old router and connected the Netgear nighthawk X10 AD7200 using the cat5e cable coming from the ONT. It connected easily . I checked all my connections and everything worked better than ever. Directions were easy to understand. My WIFI service has never been better and I get a strong signal even outdoors in my yard.The server software is easy to use and understand. I strongly recommend this router
customer_reviews.author: Russell Esau

customer_reviews.title: POS drops all the time. DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: 5G disconnects all the time. Have to reboot several times a day. Very disappointed with this router. Would NOT recommend. Customer service? Ha! Net Gear knows about all the problems. Apparently they just don't care. I bought a EERO Pro Mesh system. Solid performance. No dropped signals. Quick recovery from power flop. Extra small footprint. I just went from the Worst to the Best!
customer_reviews.author: bobk

customer_reviews.title: As promised, on time, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: My house is big and sprawling so getting good wifi throughout has always been tough. But this thing works like a champ. The hardware is disarmingly simple to install so I didn't have a chance to use tech support hence the three stars on that part of the review. I will say that it is not much to look at - it reminds me of Kylo Ren's ship which is great for the matinee but not so great in the living room. Other than that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Boedges

customer_reviews.title: LAN performance is TERRIBLE - worse than old 300Mbps router
customer_reviews.text: The wireless component is reasonable and almost delivers what you'd expect. The LAN performance is utterly dismal. I'm getting 80Mbps direct LAN connection on 600Mbps service from Comcast. With my old modem/router I got 270Mbps on a 300Mbps service. This 'new' router is TERRIBLE. I wished I would have read the tech boards prior to buying it. This has been a problem since the product was release 3 or so years ago and no fix has been created. No config changes improve it and I've spent hours on this. Netgear really blew it with this product. I'd return it, but my 30 days are up. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pickybuyer

customer_reviews.title: So far, JUNK!!
customer_reviews.text: All of the reviews that talk about this dropping internet signal are correct. I've had it replaced once, and the replacement is no better than the first. It is not stable, and the company continues to try and update firmware... they update one version of firmware for the exact same version.. makes no sense. Starting to think they are simply running the warranty out and really have no intention on providing a solution. The free router from the cable company works better than this. The speed test functions do not work at all. The Quality of Service function do not work at all. It says, "Failed, try again later." All in all, a total piece of junk. Disappointed.....
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a SCAM, don’t buy Netgear!
customer_reviews.text: Fails to work after 4 months and they are requiring me to PAY over $100(!) for tech support for “a simple and quick fix,” that they said they can do in minutes over the phone! I can’t believe this, I will never buy netgear again. How is this scam legal? It’s almost as if these devices are DESIGNED TO FAIL just outside the 3 month customer service window. Absolutely maddening, please save yourself the hassle and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: 5Ghz band completely broken
customer_reviews.text: I'm now about 1 hour into troubleshooting why I can't connect to the 5G at all. The 2.4G is pretty slow though -- I'm one room away and getting 60 mbps, when my connection should go up to 1000 mbps. Given that the 5G is completely broken, and I'm going to have to do some technology gymnastics (dumb phone calls with unavailable tech support, firmware downgrades, blah blah blah) and this router was over three hundred dollars and has multiple LEDs on the antennae -- this gets 1 star. Wish i could give it 0 stars. Get your act together Netgear!!
customer_reviews.author: San Ramon

customer_reviews.title: No WiFi
customer_reviews.text: $300.00 paperweight. Straight out of the box the WiFi 2.4Ghz doesn’t work and the 5Ghz cuts on and off. Firmware upgrades/downgrades did not help, custom firmware did not help. I spent hours on the phone with Amazon and Netgear support. Netgear determined it had to be a hardware failure. Amazon couldn’t send a replacement, only refund. Bottom line - look at the reviews and Netgear support forums - this router is trash either because of hardware or firmware issues. Buy at your own risk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: decently packaged device lots of options.
customer_reviews.text: This device is good, I got this to replace a dieing 3700v4 router. The stock firmware is fine, get the updated version. It can handle simple to simi-complex networks with ease. I have this connected to an unmanaged switch and servers along with 20 or so wifi devices. plex being offered has the ports forwarded automatically. Parental controls are locked behind a paywall.😓😦 Food device on it's own, wifi is sofar solid ... Only been two days will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: AD7200 is cutting edge but this router is garbage. LOOK AT COMMUNITY POSTS ON NETGEAR
customer_reviews.text: In most things in life paying extra for something gets you quality or cutting edge. AD7200 is cutting edge but this router is garbage. LOOK AT COMMUNITY POSTS ON NETGEAR. All wireless radios drop sporadically and regularly. This has been an issue for a year of this product continues to have signal issues with the newest firmware to date of this review. Kind of a fundamental feature of a wireless router. X8 had speed issues and X10 has wireless issues. Your losing me as a customer Netgear!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Deitz

customer_reviews.title: Poor WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. I get 940 download router to modem but the WiFi is less than 200 download on any connected device, laptop even when only 1 device is connected and in use and even when right next to the router. I had a Norton Core that was doing about 300-400 on my fastest device and was told by my ISP the NightHawk router would perform better but it is far far worse. The app is poorly designed as well...it does not show all your connected devices.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: High powered, super-awesome high-tech router that's .... not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I loved my R9000 for the first sixty days or so I owned it - it's unbelievably powerful, spreading a wifi signal throughout all three floors of my home, in all corners and even my backyard. I essentially run my entire home off wifi. But then over the weekend, the router inexplicably stopped functioning properly and Netgear tech support has been unable to remedy the situation. No settings were changed and there were no external events which would cause a change to the device's settings. For almost $500, you'd hope for more than 60 days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Resets to factory - too many times
customer_reviews.text: This the worst product ever purchased. A complete waste of money. Three calls to tech support-no help. Had a power outage, less than 2 minutes. Unit reset to factory. Had to set up from scratch. Firmware update is posted v.1.04.28 Unit reset to factory. Had to set up from scratch. Called Netgear support 3 times. When it’s working it’s a fine unit. So I say just tell me how to fix the problem with the unexpected factory resets. No one at netgear can help.
customer_reviews.author: Jay NoAmazonPhoto

customer_reviews.title: I will NOT buy another Netgear product!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I did my research on wireless routers, I was wrong! DO NOT buy Netgear product! I paid a lot of money for this, it worked for a little pass 90 days, now it disconnects from devices for no reason, my 5G doesn't work. It connects to the device, no internet connection. Do a search on Netgear Nighthawk routers, a lot of people are having the SAME issue and Netgear has no repair, the worst thing is I can't return this USELESS piece of plastic! Amazing how it is right after the warranty period ends!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet Great, WiFi Spotty
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these. We use one at our home with a cable modem and the other 3 at businesses which are with Fiber Optic. We have had issues with it occasionally dropping WiFi signal and it doesn’t have a strong signal on the second floor of our home. Firmware updates and factory rests have not corrected the issue. As far as wiring with Ethernet cables, it works great. I would recommend if you are not strictly using for WiFi. Let me know if you found my review helpful!
customer_reviews.author: VLBURKE

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: I was dumb and didn't listen to the problems reported with the ASUS RT-AC88U. I wrote a great review, then two days later it just failed. Sent it back. Let's all thank amazon.com for their return policy. This new router has better software administration. The ASUS was just not as good as it should be for an expensive router like it. It manages my many wireless and other devises perfectly throughout about 6000 square feet. Inside and out. Network cams and the like. This one is expensive, but it's rock solid. Live a little. Spend the $$. Have a perfect network once and for all. It looks bad ass too. Stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Jomach

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional performance and features
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with this router. It was simple to setup. The basic setup procedure is all most users will need. However, in the advanced mode, it has all the flexibility and optional settings that one could ask for. I coupled this router with a Netgear modem. My Wifi speed at the end of my house opposite the router is about 100% faster than with my previous router. I would highly recommend it for anyone looking for a new router with advanced features to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Blistering speed.
customer_reviews.text: This router is an amazing router. I have owned many other router from various other companies and they have always left me wanting more. This router is great and I have complete coverage in try whole home. Other routers had much weaker signals or dead zones at the outer parts on the 2200 square foot home. Dead zones do not exist with this router. Set up was extremely easy and fast. If you are in the market for a new router I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: frederick a smith

customer_reviews.title: Marketing scam
customer_reviews.text: I've built and designed routers for a living for the last 10+ years at fortune 100+ companies. I strongly recommend to not buy this product due to poor engineering design and performance. PPPoE for Fiber drops randomly, no log messages why, support is clueless DDOS protection goes off falsely blocking connections WebUI with CGI from 1990 called and wants it's tech stack back Lot's of weird fringe settings when basic network configuration if flaky, doesn't work or is missing Also thanks for blocking the login page with you app advertisement and then making the terrible app require registration.
customer_reviews.author: Lana S.

customer_reviews.title: Site blocking and QOS are hardly functional
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to block readnotify.com since they are a tracking site. The router provides "Type keyword or domain name here." I could enter readnotify.com but I wanted that and it's ipv4, ipv6 addresses. Since they may not do a DNS lookup and use a hardcoded IP address instead. IP address blocking will not work! The router provides "Dynamic QoS: Automatic traffic prioritization by application and device" Meaning I have no control. I desire to define what traffic gets priority! Now I have to buy a new router.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Gallion

customer_reviews.title: Powerful router, but still has limitations in a large house
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a much less capable router with this one. The previous router did not have the signal strength to make it from an office into a living room that was nearby. The signal had to go through an old brick wall in the house that really attenuated the signal. The Netgear router had much greater signal strength, which helped with streaming, but it still had some problems with the brick wall, especially in other regions of the house. I still had to use an extender to get the signal from the office to a bedroom. Overall, though, a big improvement over the previous router.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Eberly

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: This will be updated soon. The first one i received worked for about 2 weeks and the wifi stopped working. Worked with Netgear on problem and they were stumped. Called Amazon and they are sending a replacement. Very easy to work with Amazon to get replaced. Sending next day air. Update. Amazon great with return. got it next day. Setup router and and 2 Wifi extenders. This time all worked great. No problems. Speeds are great in all rooms now. I have setup Qos and items hooked up to system seem to work better.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: One Of The Best Router / Excellent, Super Stable with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: I am an Xfinity/Comcast customer. Set up was super easy. The router is paired with Motorola MB8600 modem, using comcast/xfinity gigabit speed package. Download speed is around 945Mbps +/- 10-15mbps, upload speed is aroud 40Mbps +/- 2-3Mpbs. Using this setup over 11 months, i dont really have any issue with it. Installed DD-WRT firmware on it on the first day i received the router. For me, the most stable DD-WRT firmware is : DD-WRT v3.0-r40065 std (06/20/19)
customer_reviews.author: Joshi

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about two weeks. Then the 2.4Ghz wifi signal would drop out and none of my devices could connect to it. This would happen at random. After going into the router settings, turning off the 2.4Ghz and clicking save, the signal would come back. However, the signal would drop again later at random intervals. After several days of this the 2.4Ghz side of things just stopped functioning entirely. No amount of factory resets or settings adjustments would bring the signal back. In reading various posts on Netgear's forums and others it appears that this is a common problem with this model. Returned to Amazon for a refund. Not what I want to see in a "nice" expensive router.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: works well recommended , printer ???
customer_reviews.text: replaced a mesh system works well , NOTE all the Netgear reviews are lumped together so when reading reviews concentrate on the ones for the item # you want , this item costs more but seems to be worth it with good results ,UPDATE the printer did not work well on wifi ,have to load lots of downloads that did not load well enough to work with my apple laptops ,i think the software is more windows compatible , i give up apple support and brother support can not help , printing by USB only now.
customer_reviews.author: zipturbo

customer_reviews.title: Trash dont buy this router and Netgear support is Trash too....
customer_reviews.text: What a trashy router. My R9000 started dropping connection on both types of connections whenever and the only way to fix it is to turn it off and on again. This isnt acceptable I need my connection to stay on all the time. Also the internet connection light on the front of the router is white and does not turn red showing that there is no internet. Expensive trash that wont stay connected and support isnt any helpful either their solution is that i dont know how to connect a router to my modem.
customer_reviews.author: Sekushii Adamina

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router I have ever owned. I needed a faster router after cutting the cable and going to an internet TV Service. They insisted on gettting the fastest router possible to prevent buffering! It has made HUGE DIFFERENCE. If you need reliable speed, and signal increase this is the one, get it you wont be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous4life

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the wireless routers I've owned (12 0f them) Repeaters were always necessary. I have a home, built in the 60's with wall to wall sheetrock. Thus, repeaters or hard-wire. Now, throughout my property, 4 out of 5 bars minimum. Based on recommendation, I will change out my wires to Cat 5e and get the speed I pay for. Can't wait to see what 10 Gigs looks like! I think I'm good for a decade.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router / Terrible Plex Server
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this 4 stars instead of 5, because the built in Plex server is absolute garbage. I won't even go into it here. Other people have the same problems I have with the Plex server. And that was 50% of the reason I bought it! But, putting that aside, not using it as a Plex server... the rest of the features and reliability and ease of use of this BEAST of a router is AMAZING! Seriously, I couldn't ask for a better, faster router. I just wish the company put more QA into the Plex server. I mean that is what they are advertising, a router with a built in Plex server.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy Geek

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase the R9000. It is not stable.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using the R9000 router for over a year. I gave up after needing to reboot it once or twice a week because wireless devices kept dropping off and wouldn't reconnect until the router was rebooted. I tried all the different firmware including the betas and disabled most of the features, it just wasn't stable. I tossed it in my spare parts bin and replaced it with an ASUS RT-AC88U which has only been rebooted once over the last two months when a firmware update came out. Maybe Netgear will come out with some stable firmware eventually but after a year I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: X10 replaces WNDR4500
customer_reviews.text: My Nighthawk X10 replaced an old NetGear WNDR4500 that served me well over the years but wasn't keeping up with the times and all the devices I have in my house. Speeds are excellent, coverage is greatly improved throughout my house. Very happy with the X10 after my first week of usage. My only real remaining question is whether I'll keep using the NetGear software, or flash DD-WRT onto it; the original intent was to do the latter, just not sure that's necessary yet.
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have two tablets, 4 smart phones, 8 Echos, 2 gaming computers, 1 security camera, and 4 tvs with fire TVs. My router that came with the cable internet service, the big box one, would drop and reset all the time. I bought the nighthawk X10 and it took all my troubles away. Super fast, no buffering, no dropping, no lagging. It is worth the money. I also bought an extender for mesh wifi connection. It may have been overkill for a 3700 sqft 2 story house, but full bars everywhere I go. Even have tv and echo in garage, full bars.
customer_reviews.author: AngryScotsman

customer_reviews.title: Must be rebooted every day to maintain speed - Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This router if functional nothing more. 1. I have the Gigabyte internets speed package from Comcast that allows for 1GB down and 35 MBS up and my devices have download speeds close to 500MBPS and upload speeds of 37 MBPS after I reboot the router. 2. After about 24 hours the speeds drop to about 10mbps download and 5mbps upload. To fix this I must reboot the router. As is such the router must be rebooted every day. Not cool Netgear! Do not buy this product.

customer_reviews.title: Serious security issues. Stay away!!
customer_reviews.text: Took delivery of the Netgear Nighthawk X10. Plugged it in and went through the guided setup. Everything was working fine. Then it said it needed a firmware update, so we did that. With the latest firmware, suddenly all of our WiFi networks were open (insecure) even though they were configured on the device to be secure and require passwords. We tried rebooting, resetting, changing the passwords, changing the encryption types, nothing worked. The admin panel in the device said the networks were secured, but they were not. Totally unusable. What an unbelievable security issue. How could they have missed this before they released the updated firmware. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sims

customer_reviews.title: I contacted Netgear support and their email back and forth process was awful and useless. I am glad that I purchased the extended ...
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product from the factory. The USB ports and the ethernet ports kept going off line and I had to reboot the router on a daily basis. I contacted Netgear support and their email back and forth process was awful and useless. I am glad that I purchased the extended service plan through Amazon. One quick contact with the Amazon team and I had a replacement part on the way. The new one seems to be working as it should. It is a shame that I had to use Amazon to resolve the product issue instead of the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: A Disaster
customer_reviews.text: The product never worked and it took 3 hours on the phone with 3 tech support people, most of whom I could barely understand, to determine that. I will admit they tried but I have seldom been so turned off by a product I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Scholte

customer_reviews.title: worked 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: thank you netgear for atleast failing within the returnable timeline product support was useless and could tell right away they wouldnt be able to help but still wasted my entire day with petty tasks trying to find something else to blame vs fixing the real problem
customer_reviews.author: Brice

customer_reviews.title: Good riddance Comcast!
customer_reviews.text: I put off installing thie Nighthawk as it does so much. I couldn’t have been more wrong! Using the app to install and set it up was very easy and I was done in no time! Highly recommend this 3-band router as my speeds are all excellent and no one is complaining anymore about the wifi being slow! Bye bye Comcast router!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie T

customer_reviews.title: I gave up and am returning this frustrating piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: This router drops off connected devices several times a day. Has dropped my Tv's off twice a day. Signal issues on all connected items. I have attempted to contact netgear, to no avail. They make it impossible to contact them. Also, in attempting to register my router, the form would not let me attach my receipt. I tried several times. Netgear service has degraded and so have the products. Chat was not available. I gave up and am returning this frustrating piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This router is a waste of money that provides poor functionality and a terrible user interface. While the signal strength is great, the device does a terrible job of managing devices. It constantly provides poor speed to devices despite having high speed internet in the house. My previous router had less broadcast range but devices could get faster internet from the device. The user interface is practically useless and offers no control or management.
customer_reviews.author: Bioman

customer_reviews.title: Got a defective one, replacement is great
customer_reviews.text: I spent 2 hours troubleshooting this router when I first got it because I was not getting a 2.4ghz signal. Decided to try a return. Amazon made the return super easy and a replacement was sent out quickly. When the new one arrived, I had it up and running within 15 minutes. The signal is great in all the corners of my house and speeds have been excellent! I will update if I have any problems!
customer_reviews.author: K. Woodworth

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for better 5G strength
customer_reviews.text: I am using this router to cover my 2 floor raised ranch 30ft x 90ft on 5G I had 4 bars at 585MB/s on most devices from either end of the house, 5 bars at 866Mb/s in the center, Tested across many devices. using dual band AC wifi. SOLID 5 bars everywhere with 2.4G and 300MB/s solid The antennas feel cheap and the spring "return to center" makes my antennas asymmetrical. (I put zip ties around the joints tight enough so I can have fine antenna adjustment ) <- $MSRP 449.99 I shouldn't have to do this My SSID is NASA..... just for fun. Other than the above average 5G signal... not excellent, this router preforms well.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Hryb

customer_reviews.title: Superb performance that is able to keep pace with a one Gb/s link - without breaking a sweat
customer_reviews.text: After having had the pleasure of utilizing many generations of NETGEAR equipment I had my doubts as to whether this router could exceed the performance of my previous router (R6900). WHile my old router was flawless in terms of reliability, this Nighthawk X10 is noticeably faster when connected to a one Gb/s link. Perhaps one of the best investments that has been spent on computer gear.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Solved all my home network problems!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an aging Apple AirPort Extreme with a new Nighthawk 7200 and it has solved all my problems. My two college-age children were forced to do their coursework from home which put a real drain on my old router. Video calls were being dropped, links dropping for no apparent reason, weak signal strength in the bedrooms, and using the microwave made everyone scream! The Nighthawk 7200 was easy to set up and ALL service issues were immediately resolved. I only wish I bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: I have to reboot this damn thing three times a day or more! Wasted $500!!!
customer_reviews.text: With 1Gb Internet from RCN and over 2100 foot condo, I decided to buy this router with two mesh devices. Everything worked fine until I noticed that the connections were getting slow. When I connected one more physical device to the Ethernet port, the Internet connection disappeared altogether. I spent hours debugging this issue until I made sure that it was the router. Then I found multiple complaints from people like me who experience this problem. I wasted $500+ on this junk!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: This Router ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this router and the Nighthawk X6S Tri-Band mesh extender. My house is 91 feet long and with this combo I cannot fail to have a superior Wi-Fi connection for every room in the home AND some distance on the property. This is exactly what I was looking for! Before my download speed was around 97 Mbps. NOW I am getting speeds of around 459 download! Thanks, Netgear!
customer_reviews.author: EBell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, these devices are already registered under someone else's name.
customer_reviews.text: Defective product, not working. When trying to set up the Router to my network, I couldn't register the device with Netgear because it was previously registered under someone else name. Due this situation, I couldn't get any support from Netgear. I immediately contacted this seller to request the credentials of previous registration to be able to change it to mine but in instead, seller surprised me with its answer; "Because they are used, you can't register them". This answer is unacceptable and also should be stated on the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik Kumar Srivatsa

customer_reviews.title: You’re house isn’t ready for this device!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those devices that are built specifically for the future. Not only do you need additional upgrades at home like CAT6 or 7 wire, a 10 gigabit switch but you need your service provider to upgrade their aging infrastructure in order for it to work. So the third triband will not be accessible unless you have devices that can see 60 ghz frequency.
customer_reviews.author: CBRNDeathDealer

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: Bought in November and it does not work now- thought it was internet provider but tech came out and said its not working at all...he did a reboot and it worked for five minutes and quit working yet again...not seeing where there is a warranty but I would like to exchange but not seeing how to do this...very expensive but told it is a good router. Willing to revise rating if I can get help. For the money, a major disappointment so far and would not buy again unless this gets resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kooser

customer_reviews.title: I gave it a big chance....
customer_reviews.text: Update: still the biggest pos ever bought After many many months of continual dropping, even going to the extreme of buying a power timer to force a daily reboot, I must conclude this is the biggest POS ever bought. The company provided several firmware updates all of which did nothing for my, or the other 1000 users, in regard to continual dropped connections. Anyone who feels my review is bogus please offer me $5 for my router.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Slow Wired Speeds
customer_reviews.text: I have a point to point wireless internet connection which is about 50mg. I replace my router because of a failure of my previous. I was only getting 8mg wired from this unit. The ISP came out and diagnosed it to be this router. They replaced it with a $39 refurbished TP-Link and it immediately got 55mg throughput. After some research there seems to be numerous people complaining about the wired connection. Giving NetGear support a shot at correcting this but will be returning if they don't have an answer by return deadline.
customer_reviews.author: Ncharg

customer_reviews.title: When it works...
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's fast and has really good range... BUT after just a month EVERY TIME the router reboots it resets to factory defaults. I've researched for a bit now and this problem occurs in a number of Netgear routers, going back a couple of years and I cannot find, nevermind a solution, even an accurate take on the reason for the behavior. My guess is a defective EEPROM (or whatever memory they store the settings in). Netgear's support didn't weigh in on any of the Netgear Community discussions of this appalling defect. I'm 20 days past my Amazon return deadline on this $400 fsck-up... Never Netgear, never again...
customer_reviews.author: Jake Heelan

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Nighthawk X10
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the Netgear Nighthawk X10 to gaming families. We have a high volume of streaming and gaming in our family and this router performs better than any other we tried. Customer service was absolutely fantastic! I had a little trouble understanding some of the new options and they took the time to not only explain, but also took the time to help get our USB backup hard drives reformatted for the best security! Love Netgear! We pay for 400Mbps internet and with this router we receive 477Mbps consistently. With our previous router we were only getting 275Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: TA Young

customer_reviews.title: This router is working now.
customer_reviews.text: Let me be clear, I would love this router if it worked the plex media.... After severals calls no Netgear support (they were really nice by the way for my experience), but even tier 2 support, several betas firmwares, many difference external hard drives, Macs, windows, etc., still not able to work (Open Flex Grey button always...) **** To this date they still have no solution to my problem (Updated, see below) ***Updated: My problem was resolved and the latest firmware fixed my issues. Could not be more pleased with Netgear support and Tier 2 team.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and great
customer_reviews.text: It was very simple and straight-forward to get installed and configured. I did see some odd behavior when trying to unblock endpoints after setting up the MAC filtering/Access Control. Everything cleared up after reboot, so I chalk it up to not rebooting the unit after the software update and all the tinkering I did when configuring it; always good to start with fresh electrons after major configuration changes. As for range, we saw a huge increase in signal strength and throughout. We can now freely roam around our 2000 sqft home, as well as all four corners of our modest lot.We're so glad that we made this purchase and we have no "buyer's remorse" at all; defintely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Router randomly loses internet, and also drops wireless devices randomly.
customer_reviews.text: Started having problems with it dropping devices from wireless several months after purchasing it. Check on line and found many people have this issue, I don't believe it is my setup, plugged out router back in and problems went away, This router may work great for some but for others not so much, we all seem to have he same basic problem, I think there are possible software issue with router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speed and coverage for multiple devices (20).
customer_reviews.text: Replaced older Netgear router that wasn’t able to handle all of the devices. The AD7200 handles all the traffic and video streaming without any problems. I am looking forward to connecting an external storage device fro 4K video storage. Provides good coverage throughout our two story home. After ordering from Amazon delivery was less than one day.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hartman

customer_reviews.title: TOP NOTCH ROUTER
customer_reviews.text: Router extrelemy easy to set. Out put speed even at a long distance very very good. Best of all netgear ready share very easy to set up and access attached USB Drive. Easiest to set up than on any router I have ever used. Good job. Sharing (plex app) makes it a snap to share on PS 3 and 4K TV works very well. Netgears automiated set up geine makes it easy for the home user even novice ones. It is my belief that this router is top notch and a keeper. I do not know how their tech support works, because of easy set up and trouble free operation I never had to call them.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH BENDZINSK

customer_reviews.title: Netgear r9000 nighthawk is useless for Parental Controls
customer_reviews.text: Netgear r9000 nighthawk is useless for Parental Controls. There is no support for this model. After buying this product and upgrading firmware, I was notified that it is no longer provided.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior Performance
customer_reviews.text: My Netgear Nighthawk X10 has been by far the best router I have ever owned. Stylish and sexy addition to my home networking setup. Using the Netgear app is a breeze. The delivery of data from all my devices is lightning fast and with 2.4 and 5GHz bands it make my life so much easier while I’m working and the kids are playing all at the same time. This is a big thumbs up to this Router!
customer_reviews.author: JayC702

customer_reviews.title: Great for families that are moderate to heavy internet users.
customer_reviews.text: With 4 kids streaming plus smart tv's and other connected devices, this WiFi router was up to the challenge. It doesn't miss a beat. Our previous high performance router would need to be reset/rebooted every few days, probably due to lack of cpu and memory. This router seems to have enough cpu and memory to handle a family of 6 streaming independently on each device. Great product for families who do more than just watch tv.
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I recently replaced my old router which was a 802.11n. Boy does the Nighthawk AD7200 make it look ancient. I had WiFi extenders to help widen my signal in my home but this router eliminates that need. I even get signal 100ft away from my home with 2 bar signals. The tri-band is also a great function and I love having remote access to my router as well. 0 regrets!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Wong

customer_reviews.title: Best Wifi Router
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Wifi Router I have ever used so far. Large covering area and strong signals for every device I have. I wore headphones whenever I mowed the lawn. The previous router from other brands could not reach the headphone because its signal was weak. I ventured to purchase this Netgear X10 and so far no regret it. I strongly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: topReview4you

customer_reviews.title: disappointing performance
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be the latest and greatest but it was no faster than our Asus AC3000, plus didn't support Express VPN unless we downloaded a bunch of third-party software to replace the Netgear interface. The thing is huge and does have lots of plugins on the back, but performance was disappointing, esp. given the price!
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Nighthawk to replace an ASUS Router that had problems handling all the WiFi devices in office and household. The new nighthawk X10 takes care of all the tasks with ease. I would buy it again in a heartbeat. Especially since the installation was easy and the cell phone App makes the upkeep simple.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hast

customer_reviews.title: QoS really works!
customer_reviews.text: We have 52 devices vying for attention on the router. I replaced the Netgear Nighthawk X6 with the newer X10 R9000 and have been delighted with the improvement. QoS is deciding nicely about who gets what in terms of bandwidth, including apportioning among six Firesticks streaming TV, seven Echo/Alexa devices and eight security cameras.So far, the X10 is rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gauger

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely flawless-High speed performance
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a NETGEAR Nighthawk X4S R7800 with this outstanding router. My X4S was very good but with GigaBit fiber service I wanted to get full advantage of the speeds available and future proof. The setup on this Netgear X10 was very simple and quick. The speeds on wireless are outstanding. I have had zero drops on either 2.4ghz or 5ghz bands. 21 connected devices including a NAS media center via the link aggregation feature offered by this router and performance has been outstanding with fantastic speeds. Highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Netgear scores a win with this Nighthawk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit to upgrade from my older Nighthawk We paid to up our home cable speed up to 300/30 and this unit was a no brained to pair up to our new modem. Netgear scores a hi mark in my book. Easy install and easy switch over. Excellent performance with increased WiFi coverage area. No longer need a repeater in back of house.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Most Powerful Router Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the most feature-filled and powerful router that I have ever purchased. The Link Aggregation setup works great with my Netgear S8000 Switch. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mervyn Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The wireless coverage is excellent over the 2
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the R9000 during the black friday sale. Once I configured the router to my network, and started testing it. The wireless coverage is excellent over the 2.4 and the 5ghz frequency. I was happily surprised that I was getting closer to my broadband width over the 5ghz. The current firmware I'm on is .20. Although the FW is good out of the box, QoS needs to be worked on and Netgear is aware of the problem and said they would have an FW update out to resolve it. The current FW is .36, but does not have the fix for the QoS...yet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't deliver what is says it does
customer_reviews.text: In an 1800 foot home this router didn't provide coverage that an older router did. Worse yet, the wireless performance wasn't any better than the old router I replaced even when close enough to get a good connection. The antenna's sure look pretty but they don't seem to do anything. The mobile setup was nice and simple but lacks features I would want during setup. Luckily once the mobile setup part is done you can just login to the interface and configure the router how you need to.
customer_reviews.author: D. Timberlake

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: First off I'd like to start by saying this thing is outrageously priced.next it only lasts about a year before consistently starts rebooting and losing all of your settings reverting to factory default over and over and over again. Save yourself a lot of money look elsewhere Netgear is garbage. And their user interface looks like it's something from the 1980s.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Great Router with few exceptions
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased and installed a Netgear Nighthawk X!0 R9000 Router advertised as the Fastest Router in the industry for Media Streaming with 2 band widths 2.4 g and 5g. I can attest to it being great for streaming with no buffering interruptions. I have 2 Amazon Fire Sticks, one in the living room and the other in the bed room. I do have one problem I cannot access the router settings. What I get is a screen for changing the ID and Pass Word. I have not attempted to go any further by changing the ID and Password.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: worst router to date
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a good experience with the r8000, so I thought it'd be safe to try this one. Surprisingly, this is the worst router I've tried in this price range. I did not think it could be this bad, but it's complete trash. Don't waste your time with this one, it just doesn't work. It's a paperweight masquerading as a router.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: No more wireless issues
customer_reviews.text: This thing handles the demands of four people online work/school/play ... no issues to report - it just works! The support guy (me) is a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: fd

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk X10 AD7200 802.11ac/ad Quad-Stream WiFi Router, 1.7GHz Quad-core Processor, Plex Media Server, Compatible with Amazon Alexa (R9000)
product_meta.description: The Nighthawk x10 AD7200 Smart Wi Fi router is industry's fastest router for media streaming with Plax media server. The x10 delivers 802. 11AC/ad Wi Fi for ultra smooth 4K streaming, VR gaming and instant downloads. With a powerful 1. 7GHz Quad core processor and quad stream architecture, you can enjoy combined wireless speeds of up to 7. 2 Gaps. Mu memo supports simultaneous streaming, while 160MHz doubles Wi Fi speeds to mobile devices. Four patent pending external active antennas amplify Wi Fi signals to maximize range and throughput. 6 months of unlimited backup to drive secures precious data from USB storage connected to the x10 router.
feature_bullets: Fast wifi performance: Get up to 2500 sq ft wireless coverage with AD7200 speed (Tri-band up to 800 + 1733 + 4600 Mbps - for 60Ghz band devices)
Recommended Up to 45 Devised: Reliably stream videos, play games, surf the internet, and connect smart home devices
Wired ethernet ports: plug in computers, game consoles, streaming players, and other nearby wired devices with 6 x 1 gigabit ethernet ports, and 1 x 10g SFP+ port.

Loaded with advanced technology: Designed with a 1.7GHz quad-core processor, 4 amplified antennas, Beamforming+, MU-MIMO, Dynamic QoS, Amazon Alexa Voice Controls, and more.System requirements:Microsoft Windows 7, 8, 10, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, UNIX, or Linux and Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 1.4, Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher
Usb connections; Share a storage drive and printer with any connected device, and create a personal cloud storage to access from anywhere, using the 2 x 3.0 USB ports
Smart parental controls: The Nighthawk app lets you manage device internet access and filter websites.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,891 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
